website_summaries.verdict: Works nicely on stubborn headlight problems, and results last for up to a year.
pros: Reasonable price point for a polisher that works with your power drill
Removes problems from yellowing or cloudy headlights with just a little bit of work on your part
Adds a protective coat to prevent re-oxidation for several months
Enough materials to work on 3 - 5 vehicles
cons: May not give you a satisfactory result on severely oxidized headlights

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think the picture speaks for itself. Easy to do. Came out so good. Had to heavily buff the lens. Can't wait to drive at night.
customer_reviews.author: KW of COS

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and Overated
customer_reviews.text: While the polishing wheel and compound seem to work well, the 1000 and 3000 grit sanding discs are absolute garbage. I attempted to use them however the results were poor and I ended up purchasing actual 800, 1500 and 3000 grit sandpaper to prep the surface. Do yourself a favor...skip this kit and buy the sandpaper at a hardware store and then used a general purpose buffing compound for the final step (see attached photos showing the difference).
customer_reviews.author: Engineer_66

customer_reviews.title: Wow! this is how a headlight kit is supposed to work!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I owned a 3m kit previously, but the sanding is necessary, in my opinion, presuming that your lights are pretty messed up! Mine were really badly damaged very hazy, not just a light haze. So the velcro pad and the quality 1000 and 3000 wet sanding disks were very effective. WET sand it like the directions say. The plastic polishing compound gave me a mirror finish using my corded dewalt drill. sealer was a nice touch. This kit rocks and will get the tough job done. The 3m kit was's t powerful enough.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: So far...so good I am a skeptic......real customer
customer_reviews.text: I just tried this product after trying a couple of the "Home remedies" Don't waste your time on home remedies. Get this stuff (I ordered it and got it within a couple of days). Being skeptical, I watched a You tube video of someone using the treatment before I started it. This was easy with really good results. Pleasantly surprised and I was done (Even taking my time to review the video and being careful) done....in fifteen (15) minutes. Taping off the headlight with painters tape is helpful. I will weigh in on the longevity in a few months. ..oh my headlight lens were terrible. Now they (in the words of my lovely wife) "Look New".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 88% Effective on my 13 year old headlamp lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Started with yellowed, blurry, almost opaque thirteen year old headlamp lenses. The process involved two hand buffering passes with 1000 grit and then 3000 grit pads simply moistened with water. This left the lenses uniformly milky yellow so I was not expecting a great outcome. However, the drill bit inserted buffering pad when used with the liquid formula turned out pretty good. I'd say the lenses are close to 90% clear. The whole process took under an hour. Oh - the final step is a clear coating of some sort that I found to be very sticky afterwards on my hands. So next time I will wear thin gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Robert v.

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than I could ever imagine
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than I could ever imagine, I have tried other products in the past and have been very disappointed. I have even paid shops to do the headlight treatments and they came out looking just a tad better than when they went in. But with this stuff I followed the directions as is and it made the lights look like new completely blew my mind.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Could be a 5 star is they included a more aggressive sandpaper
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works great...but for really bad headlights, you're going to need a little more "power". I wet sanded both lights with 600 grit paper before moving on to the included 1000 grit and then 3000 grit that comes with the kit. Took about 1 hour per lens but the results were very impressive. This was on a BMW X5 with heavy oxidation. The end result was a set of lights that looked 98% better! I only give this product 4 stars because they really should include a 600 grit sanding pad in the kit. If it has this pad, I would give it 5 stars any day!
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Really works, as long as you work hard too!
customer_reviews.text: My aged, foggy and yellowish headlights are looking better than new! Be ready to work at it! Read the instructions. Get yourself a spray bottle full of water, a few microfiber shop towels, windex and some paper towels. Kit is great but you will need all above along with a power drill. Are use the battery operated drill but you will run out of battery so I have another back up battery ready. YouTube this product you’ll see a few good instructional videos. Very happy with this purchase any results I will keep you posted I’ll let you know how it holds up. Five Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Expect Great Results
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well on the headlights of my GMC Yukon, which are glass, by following the instructions. They came out perfectly clear. It also worked very well on the headlights of my Honda Accord, which are plastic. The plastic headlights on the Honda did not come out as clear as the glass ones on the Yukon, but it made a real nice improvement. The sealer also puts a nice protective coating on the headlights which should prevent them from clouding up again.
customer_reviews.author: G. Siler

customer_reviews.title: This kit does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a used 2008 Kia Sorento. The headlights were a mess. After reading up on techniques such as toothpaste, wasp spray, & so on I purchased this kit because I wanted the headlights done right. The instructions were easy to comprehend. I have never done anything like this before to a vehicle. I spent about 25 min on the passenger headlight (left as you are looking at SUV) because I wanted to do it right. The driver headlight took less time as I was more confident. Excellent product. My husband & brothers couldn’t believe how great it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Skeemer118

customer_reviews.title: Best headlight restoration kit
customer_reviews.text: My 2008 Honda Odyssey van lights were yellow/brown so I figured I would take a chance on all the positive reviews. Well, this product worked amazingly well. I followed the directions to the letter and the most difficult part was getting the final clearcoat on without leaving streaks. Also they were great videos online if you’re a visual learner. All in all if it works for a year like it says, it’s better than the yellow!! I was also able to do two more sets of headlights with the amount of the product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Worked pretty good
customer_reviews.text: My son bought an 04 Crossfire and the headlights looked horrible. I bought this kit to see if we could get them looking a little better. Beats the 600 bucks per side to replace :) Anyway, we spent about 15-20 minutes per side and got them looking pretty good. Not quite like new but a very dramatic improvement. I can't speak to how long it will last but it worked well and was not very difficult to do. Hopefully, if we UV protect at least once per year they will look good for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: mstephe51

customer_reviews.title: Lots of elbow grease required but worth it in the end
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to put a lot of elbow grease into sanding your headlights. I used this kit on my 07 Jeep and it worked good. I wish they would've given some 750 grout sand paper to start with as it took a long time to get the oxidation off my lights. Overall it took about an hour to do both headlights. Use plastic packing tape as paper painted tape will get wet and slide off as you're sanding.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burn

customer_reviews.title: Almost new - use the final protector coat to get it to look clear!
customer_reviews.text: Good results for the price and an hour of work. After you polish with the wheel you’ll notice the headlights look much clearer when wet - the final step of putting on the clear coat helps bring this clarity out. You’ll drive yourself crazy trying to get it perfectly clear with just the polish wheel. Not a perfect result, but damn close, looks brand new from 5 feet away, definitely would use again. The final step of using the “protector” is very important to getting good results - I didn’t see this mentioned in videos or directions for the product; it would have been helpful to point this out.
customer_reviews.author: sws1967

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical,  but am thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: so this is a 2000 Grand Cherokee. It has never been in a garage and been beaten to death. I hardly even washed this thing. The headlights were almost milk whit and a flashlight worked better then the headlights did! I did about 5 minutes of sanding each headlight with each grit. Went extra long on the buffing wheel and i am happy. I seen a few reviews with folks tjat were not happy but honestly think they did it wrong. I would definitely recommend. Way cheaper then a new headlight.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well. This was my first time restoring my headlights. I chose this particular product based upon other reviews, with the deciding factors being: the drill attachment was included, and the polishing and buffing compounds were in resealable containers and it can be used for three pairs of headlamps. It only took about 30 minutes to do both headlamps. The second of the two headlamps came out a bit better than the first, so prepare and polish for a minute or two longer than the instructions say to.
customer_reviews.author: NickAllNite

customer_reviews.title: This kit worked fantastic on my moderately clouded headlight lens on our Motorhome
customer_reviews.text: This kit worked fantastic on my moderately clouded headlight lens on our Motorhome. I followed the directions and probably spent an hour or so sanding and buffing per the instructions. It has been a month and the coating in the kit after buffing has kept the lens clear and looking new. A lot of reviews were more negative but this actually exceeded my expectations and would use again. Just follow the instructions and do not get in a hurry. Use lots of blue painters tape to protect the area around the lens from the sandpaper and buffing wheel.
customer_reviews.author: J. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: amazon fulfillment sucks!!!
customer_reviews.text: the product is excellent. this had to be a customer return and amazon fulfilled - what a piece of crap! the pads, applicators were new. the wool pad was OBVIOUSLY USED. the coating bottle was OBVIOUSLY USED ITS HALF EMPTY for christ's sake...as amazon grows their fulfillment blows! TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE!!
customer_reviews.author: dtals auto studio

customer_reviews.title: The Stuff Works Great
customer_reviews.text: It finally warmed up enough for me to give this a try. I used it on a 1998 Cadillac Catera and a 2003 GMC pickup. The lenses on both were severely yellowed. Directions were straightforward and easy to follow. I masked the Caddy, but I didn't even bother with the GMC. No worries. Went from "smoker's teeth" to diamond bright. Plenty of leftovers - I could do four more cars, easy. Here's the problem: I'm really old and I don't drive at night. But if I ever have to...
customer_reviews.author: brutus sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Removed all the yellowing from my wife's Highlander's headlights,
customer_reviews.text: but didn't get rid of all of the scratches. When the headlights were back to clear, there were still gouges on the headlamp that I didn't want to try to polish out, so I left them. I used a Turtlewax product on my Highlander (his and hers blue Highlanders, can you believe that?). It has a base coat that fills in scratches and gouges, so I'm going to try that on hers this weekend. Oh, and you'll need a drill that takes a chuck key, as the shank of the polishing disk base is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Crash and Burn

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic turned believer.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical this product would work but I did notice a difference. Used this kit on two vehicles of mid-2000s age and now I’m a believer in this product. I followed the directions, didn’t need any additional tools - but I did purchase blue painters tape to protect the painted areas around the lights. That was a helpful tip. After the first vehicle was under my belt, the second vehicle went a lot smoother. I also was motivated to do another vehicle because the first set of headlights ended up with a noticeable difference. They were less yellow than before.
customer_reviews.author: bristol

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, quick, cheap. But not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is a prime example of the trade off between effort and final product. While for 10-20 minutes of work this kit performed well but did not look as good as wet sanding and applying new clear coat. Has only been on my headlights for about a month so I can’t yet speak of the products longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headlight Restoration
customer_reviews.text: This kit requires some elbow grease. I went beyond the instructions and sanded my plastic headlight covers for a while. I used my drill to buff them out using the polish multiple times. With their provided clear coat, I was able to complete 3 cars. Very happy with the results. Want to do another car, but cannot find the clear coating alone. The Kit works if you follow the instructions. Went from a safety issue due to poor visibility, to no issue at all. Great Kit!
customer_reviews.author: michael b

customer_reviews.title: Made my old lights look brand new
customer_reviews.text: This little kit made my increasingly icky-looking, 9 year old Acura headlights look absolutely like brand new. I recommend allocating enough time to go slowly and be thorough. Both lights probably took me about 1.5 to 2 hours. I made sure to keep the lights very wet while performing both sanding steps, and actually did each step (except the clear) a successive 2-3 times. After applying the clear coat, and seeing the final result, I couldn’t believe how well that the lights turned out. I can’t comment on durability, but the lights still look new after 2 weeks. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: kevinbama

customer_reviews.title: Very happy and surprised it worked
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this working. I have had friends use other kits with marginal results on headlight not as bad a condition as mine. What made me get this kit was the sandpapers. Most rely on a mild abrasive from a rubbing compound that doesn’t do the trick. The sand paper options is the only way to go. And it works. And the results from the pictures above was half-a$$ done. I was not trying for a “new” look I just wanted function. That was from start to finish about 40 minutes. If I had spent more time the damn lights would be perfect and brand new like.
customer_reviews.author: Jack J. Modic II

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Really Works
customer_reviews.text: This product works. A little bit of elbow grease and restorable headlights will be restored. The improvement was noticeable. I checked this by restoring only one headlight. The next morning it was obvious against my garage door and on the drive to work. Maybe 30 minutes total after I figured out what worked best. The Amazon price was almost $10 to $12 cheaper than Autozone. It’s been two years now. The headlights are not perfect anymore but I can do it again easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Kind of works
customer_reviews.text: My 2005 Chevy Malibu had yellowed plastic headlight covers so I thought that I would try this product. They look better now, but not as good as promised. The main problem at least with mine was that the sandpapering should be done by a drill attachment and not by hand. (I did it by hand multiple times, but not enough after I saw the results.) The covers are no longer yellow, but they are not clear either. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Victor

customer_reviews.title: Returned my badly yellowed headlights back to new
customer_reviews.text: Follow the directions precisely and take your time and the results will shock you. For whatever reason one side was more yellow then the other so I went over that one twice with the sanding pads drying it in between. Took me overall about one hour to do them both and they look showroom new. No complaints here. Not sure why some others seem to have a problem with some steps but it went very smoothly for me. As well the lenses I did were on a Honda Fit and they are very large and wide. There is enough left over as well to do more headlights so that's a bonus as well. Highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: not heavy duty but it works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit because I didn't want the hassles of having to buy one item here and there. Turns out I had to do it anyway. After you attach the buff wool pad to your drill, after a few spins, even on the lowest settings, the yellow fibers begins to disintegrate and yellow debris is left all over the place. Easy to clean up but annoying nonetheless. I started with 800 sandpaper which I had to buy. Starting with 1000 wasn't course enough. 3000 really did nothing. After a lot of elbow grease it looks better. I've applied the coating so let's see how it looks after a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: My fav

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Used this on two sets of headlights, just enough to wear out the sand paper included in the kit. I’ve always been skeptical of these kits because the new coating doesn’t always bond well, however I didn’t want to shell out for new casings so I gave it a shot. After the month so far they are still just as clear as when I first applied the treatment. If your on the fence, go for it! This kit and a little bit of elbow grease just saved me $100. I definitely recommend taking your time with the sand paper, and getting the outer casing good and clean before applying the new coating.
customer_reviews.author: morhriveion

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Just wow.
customer_reviews.text: I was only expecting my 10 year old headlights to look better, but they actually look brand new. Also, I was expecting the process to be labor intensive. I kept reading the directions thinking I was doing something wrong because it was too easy. The final polishing revealed some spots on the corners of my headlights that I didn’t get as well, but a little extra polishing fixed that. My only complaint is that the polishing wheel sheds a good bit while it’s spinning. I am thrilled with the results and my car looks 5 years younger! If it weren’t for the occasional ding, my car would look brand new with those sparkling headlights.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Foggy now Clear. Easy to do.
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions and worked perfectly. Cleaned two foggy BMW headlights. Now the lenses are clear and look like new. Heavy duty kit included everthing needed to complete the job. The sealant will help keep the headlights clear.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: You'll get good results.
customer_reviews.text: The headlight kit contains everything one needs to do a good restoration. I didn't get the *super* clarity I was hoping for; however, the car is over 25 years old so perhaps my expectations were too high. After doing one headlight using the included 1000 grit and 3000 grit sandpapers, I decided to also try 800 grit (not included in the kit) on the second headlight, hoping for better results but they both appear to be about the same. Overall, I'd say the kit works well.
customer_reviews.author: pgmr

customer_reviews.title: Sanding headlights... Yeah right
customer_reviews.text: Okay I'm impressed. Sanding my headlights? Right... They were so bad I was thinking they needed to be replaced. Didn't have much to loose so I figured go with a brand I knew provided good products. Received the package, read the directions, then watched a youtube and figured why not. First cleaned the headlight with glass cleaner. Then masked it with painters tape. Did the first sanding until the plastic looked frosted. The next sanding got them kind of clear again. Finally polished them until they were clear. But then used the wipe in the last step and was amazed! They looked new again. Took about 30 minutes from start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I just used this product and my drill did not even have much juice in it and had to finish the last by hand and they still turned out great! Dont know about the longevity but it was so easy to do that I would not mind if I had to repeat once or twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: Lourie A. Cherundolo

customer_reviews.title: ... hours to get it done and the result was awesome but it’s avout two months now and start yellowing ...
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t last more than two months I spend about 3 hours to get it done and the result was awesome but it’s avout two months now and start yellowing again, just get a professional to do it that’s all I have to say.
customer_reviews.author: Dannyjimenez

customer_reviews.title: Save some money and buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I found a product review on You Tube showing how to use this. I figured it was worth a shot since I couldn't afford to have my headlights done at an auto body shop. Start to finish that includes set up and clean up. It took about a half hr. My headlights were pretty extreme so taking that into consideration the product still worked great. I really wish I had taken a before photo. They were bad enough i couldn't drive in rain or snow on unlit roads, i was blind. 've been told I may have to do this every yr, we will see. But for the price it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: pmr

customer_reviews.title: Good results
customer_reviews.text: My 05 Acura RL’s headlight was about 15 years old now and in need of an restoration. The kit was recommended by a videos I saw on YouTube. You really need to tape off the edges of the headlight to avoid sanding into the paint job. After that just need to take your time and just follow the instruction. Many people said the clearness will go away in about a year. So I also bought some ceramic coating to top it off. Should last about 3 yrs with proper care.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Jie Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised, and not very hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because my 2009 Maxima had yellowing headlight covers. I followed the directions listed on the box and had both covers cleared in less than 30 minutes. I would say the time spent to restore your covers will depend and the severity of the discoloration. I will have to wait and see about the longevity of the product, after applying the sealant. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Summerrat

customer_reviews.title: 12yr old granddaughter...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter took the drivers side & I took the other. 35 minutes later the headlight covers on my daughters 08 Altima were as clear as factory new. Yes she scrubbed with the abrasive pads and used my old 18v dewalt cordless drill. I’m a 58 year old male with several physical disabilitys & she a 12 year old female so I propose anyone can use this and expect good results. I might add that neither one of us had previous experience in plastic restoration. Just make sure you have a couple hot battery packs for the drill. I’m not associated with any product or seller.
customer_reviews.author: JATOAV8ORTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick
customer_reviews.text: This product worked extremely well and I was very satisfied. It took about 90 minutes to clean and polish 4 headlights and there is enough product left over for 2 more. While the headlights were in OK condition, not awful like some I've seen here in Florida, they all look brand new now. After one month, the final protective coating is holding up well too.
customer_reviews.author: Triathlete Jack

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I didn't get the results I had hoped for, but that may be a result of my own laziness and it being my first time restoring headlights. I think I should have spent more time wet sanding. Still, this product improved my headlight lenses considerably. I think this product would be excellent for headlights that have not been ignored for years. A little more work in the way of the sanding process might be necessary for heavily oxidized headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: Almost... but not quite.
customer_reviews.text: The kit was great except for the solution you rub onto the headlight. I previously used the blue Meguiar's headlight restoration kit with the Headlight spray and MUCH prefer that over this rub on one. I'd go with the blue kit and use the supplied pads to clean it up before spraying the first time around, but then switch over to sandpaper in the following years (as the product only lasts about a year).
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I can see clearly now...
customer_reviews.text: We just used this on a 2004 Hyundai (kid's car) and WOW what a difference! The headlights look like new and now he can see further down the road. (Phew). I would recommend that prior to using this, you read the directions, tape-off around the light lens, and take your time with each step. I did both lights in less than 30 minutes. There's even enough left to do it again should it become necessary. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Barkley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My 2009 Honda Oddessy headlight lenses were very cloudy and looked terrible. It took about 20 minutes per headlight lens but the Meguiar's G2980 Heavy Duty Headlight Restoration Kit worked perfectly. Unfortunately, I only took one picture of the completed driver's side. I have a lot of the product left over for future use if needed on other cars. Highly recommended :-)
customer_reviews.author: Lak

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Easy to Apply
customer_reviews.text: What a difference! My headlights look almost like new after using this product. My 2008 Toyota Rav4 headlights were really cloudy and I was not getting good night vision as a result. Buying new headlamps and having them installed was going to cost me @$500. Instead, I decided to try this kit and so far, I'm very happy with the results (see the attached before and after pictures). I'm not very handy, but the instructions were clear and easy to follow. It was a simple process to use the kit and I was pleasantly surprised with the results. It saved me money and helped solve the problem I was having with my cars headlights. Worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Its easy and it does miracles!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2005 Accord that had that bad headlight lens fogging. Before I purchased other headlights, I decided to try the Meguiar's G2980 Heavy Duty Headlight Restoration Kit. I am glad I did. The instructions were clear and it was a fast, easy job. When I got done the results were just miraculous. Exceeded my expectations. It has been several months now and my headlights still look great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul

customer_reviews.text: I'm not gonna lie this product was easy and simple to apply. It's been approximately 6 months since I used it and the polish is just fading slowly. I don't see a drastic change currently but I can see it fading away. But the main reason why I bought this product was for yellowing. I was able to make my lights clear, but not crystal clear as it shows in pictures. It could be my car's headlights too not sure on how to judge the results on that.
customer_reviews.author: Qasim

customer_reviews.title: Correctly cleans your lens
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my expectations were too high but when I bought this, I wanted my car lights to be as clear as new but it only lasts so long before I felt the difference dissipated. I wanted to see my bright future ahead of me, but its not as bright as LED lights. Still, it feels like I cleaned the lights properly and I felt confident that I didn't damaged my car in anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Demetri

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Results than I Expected!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This was an amazing transformation from cloudy lenses to almost looking brand new. It took about an hour (including applying masking tape) with moderate effort sanding. The provided tools were excellent, and I am surprised at how good the results are! Used the kit on our 2008 Acura TL, and now my wife can see much better at night with clear lenses. I give this product 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Let just say this product works, I've tried the many remedies on the web and this is by far hands down the one that worked best. It's too late for my 07 Silverado, I changed these headlight assemblies already. Restored the minivan and Volkswagen. What a difference during fall early morning commutes. Make this product better by adding extra sanding disks.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Magic it works!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hello , let me start off by saying i am a normal everyday diy. Kind of person ...all I can say is I wish I took before pictures!!!! Tried similar products didn't do much .as long as you follow exactly what the instru tions say, this stuff works and definitely tape off around area prior to starting..did an 03 dodge Durango with very yellow headlights and now they look NEW!!! not sure how long product lasts as I have just done them that's why I left longevity of prouduct blank ..but as for rest of it I'd recommend this stuff!! 09/09/2020
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works great
customer_reviews.text: I had cloudy headlights and did not want to pay someone to 'clean' them. So I bought this product to try and was a little skeptical if it would truly work since it looked so easy to use. All that you need is a power drill and does work wonders. My headlights look brand new. I would highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Krystina Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Restored my headlights!
customer_reviews.text: My Toyota truck headlights had become greatly diminished to a milky-white. I was about to purchase complete replacements at a great expense, but found the Meguiar's restoration kit. I followed the directions explicitly and got tremendous results. They are "good as new." I have enough product to use on at least two more autos. Saved me a bundle.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: I should have started with Meguiar's!!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously used another name brand with less than acceptable results. Meguiar's took "much" less effort with a near factory new look. Very impressive!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get your own sand paper and glass cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy for multiple cars with heavy oxidation. If you do buy your own sand paper because the provided ones barely made it threw the 2 headlights, leaving a very sticky smear on the lens from the adhesive used under the sand paper. With that said the drill attached buffer is a nice touch, the up protective coat seemed very watery compared to other brands and would recommend several coats applying one allow to dry and reapply.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the ease of use and results
customer_reviews.text: Very complete kit and worked well. I would suggest finding a You Tube video to view someone actually completing all of the steps for best results. A video I found was very helpful since this was my first attempt at renewing faded headlights. I bought this for my wife's car but was so pleased with the results that I went ahead and refinished my truck headlights too. Everything you need is included in this kit. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got cloudy headlights - this stuff works
customer_reviews.text: I had tried toothpaste and other cleaners to restore cloudy headlights on my 2004 pickup. Nothing was working. did some research and bought this product. Within minutes I had the lights looking like new. Easy to use and great results. I liked it so much I also restored the lights on my car. Still have enough product to do a few more if I had them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick George

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the other positive reviews and was skeptical. I ordered it because the cost of purchasing new headlights was $200+. I took a chance and watched some YouTube videos that used the product. It took about 30 minutes to do both headlights and they look nearly perfect. My only caution is that while using the final coating providing, only wipe one time. Don't go back over your coating as it will smear it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dananay Fam

customer_reviews.title: Meguire's Headlight Restorer
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Takes some muscle to get the work done but the results were stunning. Follow directions exactly. I was so impressed that I did another car that was showing a little bit of cloudiness, and it came out very nice. That was over four months ago and both look great today. I will probably apply the clear coat again this month to keep the shine going.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: The Kit Worked Exceedingly Well
customer_reviews.text: Our 2006 Honda Pilot had severe yellowing/cloudiness of the headlight lenses. I tried several products with marginal success prior to buying this product. But I was AMAZED at the results of this kit. The lenses look brand new and look just as good as the lenses on our 2016 Mazda CX-5. It took me about an hour to complete and the whole process was very easy. The great results energized me to wash and wax the Honda which hasn’t been waxed in a long time. I highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Volusian

customer_reviews.title: Let it shine
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the ease this product turned my dull headlights into an almost new look. The one element I added to the process was to use water during the buffing stage to allow the compound to work easier. The results were near perfection. I liked it so much on my car, that when my daughter drove over later the same day I did hers with equal results.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: This works pretty well. It's not a complete solution but it ...
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well. It's not a complete solution but it did a rather good job. I might not have wet sanded long enough. It says you need 24 hours to fully cure the last step (sealer) So do this in a garage and give it time. The plus side is that I still have plenty of their material so I can take another, and longer, stab at it. it's a good product that does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews of this product before purchasing this product. I also watched several how-to videos specific to this product. I followed the directions from the package and from the videos to the letter and it worked perfect. Keep the spray bottle full and use plenty of water when you are doing the sanding and it gets it very clean. They give you plenty of cleaner/polish so don't be afraid to use it. I don't know about the longevity yet as it's only been a couple days. These headlights I did were bad and look very new like now. Once again follow directions and educate yourself before you do it.
customer_reviews.author: rmurawski

customer_reviews.title: It Works!!
customer_reviews.text: having two young kids, I hadn't been out at night in about 10 years - no kidding!! Anyway, I was driving home and night and realized I could barely see, low and behold my headlights were foggy. This kit fixed that up. It is super simple to do and my lights are now clear again. How Simple? My 11 yo did one headlight and it looks just as good as the one I did. I highly recommend this product. I tried all the "home remedies" before hand and this was the only thing that worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works and Much Cheaper Than Getting the Lens Professionally Done
customer_reviews.text: Last year I had our neighborhood mechanic clean the light and after $75 it looked terrific. When it started to get dull this winter I couldn't see spending another $75. I tried the toothpaste - it was ok but not great. Saw this restoration kit on Youtube and thought that I would try it. It was super easy to do. only took a few minutes and looks just as good as the $75 professional job. There is still enough in the kit to do it again in future years.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product That Lasts About a Year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the kit I used. I've used this kit on 4 headlights and 2 fog lamps-all badly oxidized. They all came out crystal clear. Follow the directions and make sure the surface is wet when sanding. I first used this 3 months ago and the headlights are fine. Update: The restoration lasts about a year if you park outside. Just had to re-do my headlights. They look great again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Used on a 94 Buick with 215000 miles on the headlights and a Chrysler Town and Country with 143000 miles. Wife noticed the positive difference driving home in the dark. She normally won't notice a front end rebuild. and new shocks. I presanded with 800 grit then used the kits 1000grit pad. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Remington

customer_reviews.title: It makes headlights like new.  Really!
customer_reviews.text: This really works great! Be ready, when you are sanding the headlights it looks like the oxidation is not going away. But when you put the buffing pad on and use the special goo, it completely cleans off everything. One thing; go to the hardware store and get 1500 grit sandpaper. The 1000 grit sanding pad can loose it's grit. It's helpful to have more.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The entire process took about 15 minutes per side. I didn't take before pictures, but the lights had some serious pitting and discoloration on the top. 30 minutes and a little elbow grease and they look new now. Make sure you keep the surface wet while sanding, and clean with glass cleaner between sandings and before the protective coat. Once that coat dries, I buffed with a lint free towel and they're perfect. I only used a fraction of the buffing compound and sealer, and the sandpaper (1000 and 3000) still look new. Plenty of water when sanding!
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Great Restoration Product
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple of these products and while they do a great job, don't expect them to restore the clarity back to a factory replacement level. I'm not sure why that doesn't seem to be possible, maybe it requires more than a couple of applications and a lot more polishing. Regardless of that, the light is now completely usable and I will be polishing it up again in a year.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Easiest kit I ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at a pick a part lot. There 14 years old. Now after just a few hours they look brand new. Take your time sanding. Dont rush. I've tried other restore kits on other lights. You work and work and only get satisfactory results. This is my new goto product for any automotive lenes that get affected by the sun. First picture is a before on the right and after on the left.
customer_reviews.author: Chronic-Pain

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Each step of the process was clear and fairly simply simple to execute, took me about 2 hours for both headlights as I had never done headlight restoration prior to. All haze from the 1000 and 3000 grit sandpaper was quickly cleared up with the PlastX and provided drill pad. Very pleased with the results on a 2012 Hyundai Tucson that has not been garage kept. The results are not "absolutely perfect omg it looks brand new", but this kit did a great job. See photos for before and after photos.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter D.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works! And it was easy!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from my before & after photos, this stuff is amazing! It only took me about 30 minutes to do both headlights. Line up your supplies before you begin: several microfiber cloths, some windex, a bucket of water, painter's tape, a drill, and the items from the kit. Then just follow the instructions on the box step-by-step. You too can make your old yellow headlights look brand new!
customer_reviews.author: PaisleyAlligator

customer_reviews.title: Simple and affective
customer_reviews.text: Overall, Husband very happy. Took some elbow grease but pretty straight forward. The headlights were getting hazy on our 2008 Acura MDX. Not the worst but starting to affect visibility. You can see the difference, left side wasn't treated, right side finished. Plenty left for multiple headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Liang

customer_reviews.title: This is the kit to get!
customer_reviews.text: Got this kit to do my wife's headlights that were hazing over. So far I've done 3 sets of headlights and the kit still has enough product to do at least 3 more. I got this kit a few months back for $20. I restored the headlights on the neighbors car and she paid me $20 so the kit is basically free for all my other cars! Lol
customer_reviews.author: James P. White

customer_reviews.title: Great results for $20.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband's vehicle which we had already paid to replace one headlight on. We figured if it didn't work we were going to replace the light anyway. Be patient and read all the instructions before you begin. The process was easy and so far results look great. Not sure how long results will last but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: moore213

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT RESULTS
customer_reviews.text: Did two cars with very good results. Each of the cars have in the past been done by a so-called professional headlight restoration service. The McGuiar's kit proved to do a superior job. One car was a 2012 Genesis and the other a 2001 Acura. The tan fog on both headlights was replaced by very clear lenses. Happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: T. Irwin

customer_reviews.title: A picture is worth a thousand words, so here are two!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think the pictures speak for themselves!!! I was amazed. All I needed was my regular cordless drill, and a microfiber cloth. If you are careful, like me, you don’t need to tape off your paint by the lights. I will use this product from now on, I was about to buy NEW headlights for $120 plus, because I’ve tried other products before, and nothing has worked until now. AMAZING results!!! I would say it took me less than an hour to get both headlights done.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easy and seriously impressive!
customer_reviews.text: WOW. This product well exceeds my expectations. My 9 year old helped me with the sanding (I followed behind to make sure it was complete) and I handled the drill. This definitely takes some elbow grease, including the drill step, but overall the process was simple and easy. And I could not be more impressed with the results. One package was more than enough to complete both of my headlights and I still have quite a bit of the two chemicals left. Could probably pick up some more 1000 and 3000 grit paper and do another set of headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Lind

customer_reviews.title: Look Like New
customer_reviews.text: My headlights were moderately obscured on my 2013 Camry. I was worried because they were not terrible and did not want to make it worse. Also, there is a lighter version of this product by Meguiars. Anyways, I did one light in 20 minutes, and was so impressed that I went to work on the other right away. I can’t vouch for the longevity. Also, Sam’s Club will do them for $50 with a five year guarantee. I like doing things myself and would highly recommend. All you need are the microfiber cloths and a drill.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boone

customer_reviews.title: Cures even the worst hazing
customer_reviews.text: tried all the other shortcuts and they never really did much on Acura headlight. this however was easy to use and did an excellent job. use painters or masking tape around the headlights. use the sealant sparingly or it will run. you do not do not do not want any of it on your paint. one kit did 2 sets and i had some left over. now the only complaint I had was the cheap quality of the sanding discs. the backing was already peeling off it when i openen the box. when i put on the applicator it separated from the disc so i finished by hand.
customer_reviews.author: turner

customer_reviews.title: Dull Headlight Cover
customer_reviews.text: This polishing kit really works. I had tried some of the others and they really didn't do anything, they were kind of like just applying a coat of wax. This kit is designed to actually buff and polish the plastic step by step and it really works. I was very impressed. I have plenty leftover too in case I need to do it again or treat other headlight lenses. I would recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel.B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, just amazing! I’ve tried several headlight restoration products including products from 3M and I have to say, this product is easy to use. Just follow the clear and easy steps on the box and bam! Effortless, in 15 min, my left headlight looks like new. I have a 2004 VW Jetta GLI with a fairly new right headlight (5 years old) and the left one looked like it had cataracts. Now, it matches the right headlight. It says it’ll last about a year esp with the protection coat (that you apply at the very end). Best one yet!
customer_reviews.author: RAV2

customer_reviews.title: I wish I followed another person's recommendation of purchasing and using diff grades of sand paper to do a better job, but it worked
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to use, I did two layers of painters tape to protect the paint around the lights. I wish I followed another person's recommendation of purchasing and using diff grades of sand paper to do a better job, but it worked, looks much better than when I started, but not amazingly like new looking.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned many, many years of trouble from my headlights about 3 months ago. I used the instructions though I also watched a few YouTube videos. The second headlight went much faster than the first. No problems. The big question mark is "how long" to do each step. I worked a bit harder than the videos showed. Whatever I did, it worked great. Just about every time I turn on my headlights at night, I am grateful for how much light I now get.
customer_reviews.author: UTChief

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on 2004 Honda Pilot. For the last 5 years it has been outside the garage (newer one inside). The headlights were badly yellowed. I followed the directions and the outcome is perfect. I was so happy to see that it worked and I saved money doing it myself. Buy it; you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb in NC

customer_reviews.title: It didn't do so good
customer_reviews.text: They should have provided a lower grit sandpaper. And add an extra step, My headlights were in two bad of shape for just the two grits to work. In other words "It didn't do a good job". Better but not great. The instructions should also tell how long to sand in each stage and how much pressure to use.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding results
customer_reviews.text: Like most older Lexus, our headlights were foggy and yellowing. We used Sylvania headlight restoration kit on our first car with so-so results. The meguiars kit was highly recommended on the Lexus forum. This kit was quicker and easier to use with outstanding results. I wish I would've taken a before picture. We had enough product to do 2 sets of front headlights. It only took 30 min on each set start to finish. There are many good YouTube videos on how to use this product. Just make sure to tape off the lights and keep them wet with a spray bottle as you sand.
customer_reviews.author: Layla Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Impressive and Simple
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about trying this, but the reviews made it seem like a good bet to try. Within about 1/2 hour and following the easy instructions, I turned 12 year old Honda Accord headlight lenses into practically new ones! Not sure about longevity yet, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS SEXTON

customer_reviews.title: Another quality Mequiar’s product
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions as written and I am impressed with the results. One thing the instructions do not mention is how much pressure to apply when sanding. On the first headlight I was a little cautious and went on the lighter side. After applying the PlastX with the buffer I still had a few cloudy areas. No problem - just resanded those areas and repeated the buffing. On the second headlight I applied more pressure the first time when sanding and it turned out great the first time. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: LH75

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Shine
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Follow the easy instructions and little elbow grease, my headlights looked like they were day 1 out of the dealership. All the material (Minus the microfiber towels) were included in the kit. I’ve used other headlight restorers before on my other car and the result was not even close to this one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Revnyce

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last October and just finally used it on my Mom’s 2009 Honda CRV which has always been parked outside in the country. Her headlights were pretty bad. Afterwards they look almost new. Pretty amazing results. It was an easy process. I also bought tape and cut up a plastic bag to make sure I didn’t damage the paint. I’m so happy with the results I’m looking for other friend/family vehicles to do. On a related note, I also used a heat gun on the plastics to make them look new (Google the process). Made my mom’s day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked Exactly as advertised. This product was very easy to work with, and did a remarkable job. My advice, is followed the directions to the letter. Do not assume anything, and don't skip any steps..... My headlights look awesome... I wish I took some Before & After photos because they actually would look better than what's advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely am ecstatic about this product. Hands down best i have ever used on my headlights. I have used 3m but wasnt completely satified but Meguiars," Awesome". I got to excited about using it and forgot to take a before pic, but my headlight were a dingy yellow and my car is white so it looked horrible. Thanks Meguiar's.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: No more yellowish headlights
customer_reviews.text: My 2004 model year car's headlights are shining brightly once more. This stuff really works to restore the headlight lens. It is nice to have just about all the parts you need in the box; you just need to supply your own microfiber cloth and drill. The first picture shows the untreated lens on the left of the pic, and the treated lens on right (i.e. the car's left headlight), and the second picture shows a partially treated headlight lens where the top portion is untreated, and the bottom is treated.
customer_reviews.author: tmy

customer_reviews.title: Great, Easy to Use Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based off a recommendation from our long time mechanic and it worked like a charm. The kit was easy to use and made a HUGE difference. I had tried other products in the past and nothing was able to defog my headlights like Meguiar's. My headlights have been fogged for years and recently it started becoming a real issue at night. Im happy I could purchase a $25 product to fix my issue as opposed to buying new lenses. Highly recommend! The only constructive criticism I will provide is the kit does not come with a microfiber cloth, so make sure you have one before you start and read the directions through. Also charge your drill!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and should get multiple uses out of it
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works amazing. My headlights were pretty foggy and I was skeptical that this would work, but once I finished the whole process which takes about 20 minutes in total for both front headlights. You’ll end up having enough left over to either save or use elsewhere. I used the extra meguiars i had on the chrome areas of my bumper which had gotten some water spots that I havent been able to get out. Also very pleased with the results from that. This stuff is awesome and I suggest everyone to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Packer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive results
customer_reviews.text: This kit worked so well, I was so impressed I suggest it to my dad. The process was simple, definitely requires a bit of elbow grease but if you take your time follow the instructions your results will be undeniable. Photos are after two months of use and a 1200 mile round trip and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Euan SH

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on my 2003 Toyota (see photo). I probably could have spent more time to get it perfect, but one pass with each of the sanding pads and the polish was enough. The only thing I'm not sure about is the longevity.. usually old headlights lose their shine again after a few weeks or months, so I'm interested to see how long this lasts. They include a protectant coating so that should help. I'll update the review if it doesn't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie W.

product_meta.title: Meguiar's G2980 Heavy Duty Headlight Restoration Kit
product_meta.description: Meguiar's Heavy Duty Headlight Restoration Kit is the easy way to obtain professional results restoring clarity to uncoated clear plastics with a standard corded drill. This inclusive kit comes with everything needed to safely and effectively remove heavy oxidation, cloudiness, and yellowing while delivering crystal clear results. Eliminate defects with included sanding discs and then polish up clarity with PlastX Clear Plastic Cleaner & Polish and Easy-Buff Wool Pad attachment using a standard corded drill. Follow with Headlight Coating to preserve brilliant clarity and protect from re-oxidation for up to a year.
feature_bullets: PROFESSIONAL RESULTS: Cleans oxidized, yellowed and hazy headlights
REVOLUTIONARY COATING: Protects against yellowing and re-oxidation of headlights for up to 12 months
HEADLIGHT RESTORER: drill powered polishing combines with sanding for outstanding results
CRYSTAL CLEAR HEADLIGHTS: Enhances visibility & safety for night driving
MAKES HEADLIGHTS LOOK NEW: professional, clear finish to heavily oxidized or cloudy headlights
